channel.title: business-intelligence on The Digital Talk
channel.description: Recent content in business-intelligence on The Digital Talk

item.title: Data Governance Components – 1. Organization Sphere
item.description: In the previous blog on “Framework for Data Governance,” I discussed and introduced the three spheres of data governance. This blog focuses on the first sphere called “Organization Sphere” and tries to explain in detail the factors and levers in this sphere

item.title: How is Data Governance (DG) different in Digital World
item.description: The need of Data Governance has been established at it has become one of the key initiative’s organizations are focusing on when it comes to managing the data.

item.title: Introduction to Delta Architecture
item.description: In my previous blogs I have introduced Kappa and Lambda Architectures. These architectures are big data architectures and designed to support massive amounts of data both in real time and at rest.

item.title: Redesigning Enterprise Analytics Teams
item.description: Cloud technologies are changing the way we operate and do business. They enable us to focus the time and energy of the resources in developing applications rather than spending time on the maintaining the infrastructure.

item.title: Lambda Architecture using Databricks
item.description: From technology point of view Databricks is becoming the new normal in data processing technologies, in both Azure and AWS. This post provides a view of lambda architecture and uses Databricks at front and center.

item.title: Analytics Maturity (Part 1) - Introducing the Chasm
item.description: “The world’s most valuable resource is no longer oil, but data” — The Economist The above statement and article by The Economist sums up very nicely what we are reading, seeing, and witnessing everyday.
